entries: {@b Ally.} Grant your ally {@dice 1d6} damage reducation on magical effects for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} Deal {@damage 1d4} lightning damage each turn for the duration.

entries.name: 5. Emperor
entries: {@b Ally.} Grant your ally {@dice 1d6} damage reducation on magical effects for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} Deal {@damage 1d4} acid damage each turn for the duration.

entries.name: 6. Hierophant
entries: {@b Ally.} Your ally suffers no effects from being prone, and they do not take attacks of opportunity for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} Knock your enemy prone. They cannot stand up for the duration.

entries.name: 7. Lovers
entries: {@b Ally.} Ally charms creatures within 5 ft of them for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} Makes all creatures hostile towards the enemy for the duration.

entries.name: 8. Chariot
entries: {@b Ally.} Grant ally 15 feet movement speed for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} Slow enemy 15 feet movement speed for the duration.

entries.name: 9. Justice
entries: {@b Ally.} Attacks made against the ally are made with -2 to the attack roll.
{@b Enemy.} Attacks made against the enemy are made with +2 to the attack roll.

entries.name: 10. Hermit
entries: {@b Ally.} Grant +1 Armor Class to the ally for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} Apply -1 Armor class to the enemy for the duration.

entries.name: 11. Wheel of Fortune
entries: {@b Ally & Enemy.} Roll on the Wild Magic table. For enemy, roll twice.

entries.name: 12. Strength
entries: {@b Ally.} Ally makes STR saving throws at advantage. For STR checks, act as if ally STR score is 20.
{@b Enemy.} Enemy makes STR saving throws at disadvantage. For STR, enemy automatically fails.

entries.name: 13. Hanged Man
entries: {@b Ally.} Heal ally {@dice 1d6} each turn for duration.
{@b Enemy.} Enemy is {@condition Poisoned} for the duration.

entries.name: 14. Death
entries: {@b Ally.} Allies within 30 feet roll death saves with advantage.
{@b Enemy.} Enemies within 30 feet roll death saves with disadvantage.

entries.name: 15. Temperance
entries: {@b Ally.} Ally rolls Concentration checks with advantage.
{@b Enemy.} Enemy rolls Concentration checks with disadvantage.
{@i Note.} If target has no spellcasting ability, the card instead casts {@spell grease} on the target, then ends its effect.

entries.name: 16. Devil
entries: {@b Ally.} Creatures within 30 feet of ally treat them as if they are invisible.
{@b Enemy.} All creatures become invisible to the enemy when within 30 feet.

entries.name: 17. Tower
entries: {@b Ally.} Movement becomes 0 feet. Attacks against ally have a -10 on the attack roll.
{@b Enemy.} Movement becomes 0 feet. The creature is petrified for the duration.

entries.name: 18. Star
entries: {@b Ally.} Emit starlight. Enemy creatures who look at ally are blinded for 1 minute if they fail the Haruspex's Spell Saving Throw.

{@b Enemy.} Enemy creature emits starlight. All enemy creatures who can see the targeted enemy must make a Spell Saving Throw. If they fail, they must get as close to the light as possible. All within attacking range must make an attack at disadvantage on the enemy.

entries.name: 19. Moon
entries: {@b Ally.} All attacks the ally makes are treated as if they were made with a vorpal weapon for the duration.
{@b Enemy.} All attacks the enemy makes gain no modifiers to the attack or damage rolls for the duration.

entries.name: 20. Sun
entries: {@b Ally.} Ally emits heat. All enemies within 20 feet must make a Card Saving Throw of gain a level of exhaustion each time they fail. Enemies who save against this effect have all levels of exhaustion cleansed.

{@b Enemy.} Enemy emits heat. All enemies other than the target within 40 feet must make a Card Saving Throw of gain a level of exhaustion each time they fail. Enemies who save against this effect have all levels of exhaustion cleansed.
{@i Note.} Enemies cannot die from this effect. As such, the maximum level of exhaustion this card can place is five.

entries.name: 21. Judgement
entries: {@b Unique.} When casting this card, choose both and enemy and an ally. All damage done to the ally is also done to the enemy. All healing done to the enemy is also done to the ally.

entries.name: 22. World
entries: {@b Ally.} While this card is active, on each of the ally's turns, they may choose one attack, spell or effect that happened in the previous round (since their previous turn). This effect simply ceases to exist. Allies will remember that this effect had happened.

{@b Enemy.} While this card is active, each round, the haruspex who placed this card may choose one attack, spell or effect that has occured to the target of this card. The effect/damage of the chosen attack/spell/effect is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Future Sight

prerequisite.other: Either the Haruspex class or the DM's permission.

entries: You can use this feature to see the future for a turn. When you see into the future, you see the movements and attacks enemies within 20 feet will make against you. You have advantage on Dexterity Saves and attacks made against you are at disadvantage for the next turn. You also gain a bonus to damage attacking these enemies.

optionalfeature.name: Fragmented Blast
entries: When you cast the Eldritch Blast Cantrip, you can roll an extra attack roll for a creature within 10 feet behind the initial target, dealing {@dice 1d6} damage on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Supporting Actor
entries: Your familiar appears as a marionette mockery of its original form and has a more doll like personality almost stalkerish in its mannerisms, whenever you cast an illusion or enchantment spell you can choose to cast it as though the familiar was the point of origin for the spell when determining the range and available targets.

optionalfeature.name: Guided Story
entries: Whenever you awaken you are able to trade one of your hit die in exchange for two free casts of {@spell clairvoyance}, this guidance takes place in the form of an illustrated story that draws itself on the pages of your tome and is capable of being seen by any individual who witnesses it. This effect lasts one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Mightier Than the Sword
entries: Your weapon from the Pact of the Blade feature is coated in a dark ink like liquid that drips from every inch onto your skin and the ground below, when this ink touches a magical item or an object that has been influenced by some way via magic it will transcribe the effect the item holds or alternatively can translate any language the ink coats.

optionalfeature.name: Storyteller of Control
entries: You can cast {@spell mass suggestion} without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Actor Recruitment
entries: Whenever you cast a spell that alters a creature's perception or understanding of reality such as {@spell friends} or {@spell minor illusion} treat the active time as a minimum of ten minutes.

monster.name: The Ancestor

hp.special: Your Intelligence modifier multiplied by half your Kindred level (rounded down).

languages: understands Common, but does not speak

trait.name: Spirit Inheritence
entries: All stats gain an increase based on either your Constitution Modifier or your Intelligence Modifier. Strength, Dexterity and Constitution gain a bonus equal to your Constitution Modifier, and Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma gain a bonus equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

action.name: Spiritual Rend
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 3} + half your Kindred level to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 2d4} + your Intelligence modifier force damage.

action.name: Human: Spiritual Adaptability.
entries: Add an additional {@damage 1d4} damage to every attack made by the Ancestor. If the additional damage causes an attack to be lethal, then the Ancestor gains an additional turn to its summon duration. This feature can only be used once per summon.

action.name: Elven: Spirit Arrow.
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} + half your Kindred level to hit, range 120 ft.,  a number of targets up to your Constitution Modifier (minimum 1). Hit: {@damage 1d12} + your Intelligence modifier psychic, radiant or thunder damage, chosen upon rolling the attack. A spell attack roll must be made against each target's AC, though the damage is rolled only once, then applied to each target.

action.name: Dwarven: Spiritual Endurance.
entries: When your summon takes damage that would kill it, it makes an attack at its attacker. If the attack hits, subtract the damage of the Ancestor's attack from the damage taken. If it reduces the damage to zero, the attack is negated. If the damage done to the Ancestor is now negative, the attack takes that damage instead. This feature can only be used once per summon.

action.name: Gnomish: Spiritual Ingenuity
entries: Every target that is killed by the Ancestor during its summon duration grants it {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points and a +1 to its Armor Class. These bonuses reset upon summoning a new Ancestor.

item.name: Tarot Deck
entries: This deck consists of 22 cards, each depicting one of the Arcan Gods that popuate the realms. Is normally used for tarot readings but can also be used by a Haruspex as an arcane focus.
Readings are normally done by haruspex or those aligned with the whims of fate and fortune. Each card has a different meaning, depending on whether it is drawn Upright or Reversed.

entries.name: Kindred
entries: The kindred class is a melee spell slinger, who uses the souls of their ancestors to power their magic and abilities. Kindred are rare throughout the lands of Komalitr, choosing to hide their secrets away, only coming out in times of need, or when new prodigies must be chosen to carry the secrets of the kindred on to a new generation.
Kindred can use their power in three, sometimes four different ways, depending on their training. Each method employs different boosts to their combat and spellcasting abilities.

Kindred can summon the spirits of their ancestors and of other kindred who have come before them to fight in battle. Not all kindred can do this, as it requires intimate connections with the spirits brought onto the material plane, and can be quite taxing on the individual.

entries.name: From the Far
entries: A Kindred's power comes from the far reaches of magic and manner. They often use abilities that are beyond understanding. Many magic users even find that their abilities are transferred through hereditary means and can be gifted from one kindred to another, though the kindred are very protective of those who can manage the kindred power.

entries.name: Give and Take
entries: Kindred have to give and take spirits, in order to maintain the balance of life. This is done through the use of their spirit pools, as it allows the kindred to use their abilities, expending these points for use.

entries.name: Go Softly Now
entries: When a kindred dies, they are told to "go softly into her arms". The witch of the afterlight, often visits the kindred in their dreams. She is pure and loving, and appears to be a moon elf, from long ago.
She is the opposite of the Baba Yaga. Her name is Yadeyah. She is the spirit matron, and it is her job to guide the souls of kindred into their afterlife.

entries.name: Creating a Kindred
entries: When creating a kindred, think about their origins more than anything. Where did they come into contact with other kindred? Were they given these powers through trust, or other circumstances. These decisions can help shape the character, and can influence their spell selection.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a kindred quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose any background.

entries.name: Haruspex
entries: The haruspices are known as 'fortune-tellers' to some, and 'con artists' to many, however few truly understand the magic at work behind the cards. Haruspices are influencers of fate, magic and the arcane. The cards they draw influence the world, and can give or take the powers of those around them.
What may seem a simple card to an observer may be a burden on the target, cursed to suffer its effects. The reversed tarot are a dangerous tool when in the hands of a haruspex.
The same can be said for an upright card pulled by a haruspex. it can mimic the blessing of a god, if only for a limited time.
The energy found within a haruspex's cards mimic the presence of a holy symbol of a Cleric, or a royal amulet of a noble, both in power and recognition.
Depending on the city, government or individual, a haruspex might be praised, humiliated or hunted. Their magic is often seen akin to that of a warlock, though they do not inherently cast any spells.

The power of the haruspex can be compared to the inherited magic of a Sorcerer, but also the pact-born magic of a Warlock. Though it is not fully certain where it first began, most haruspices are taught the tarot-based magic by a close relative or mentor. Cases have been found where ordinary men and women are blessed by a God or Goddess and develop the abilities of a haruspex, though it is a rare occurance.

entries.name: All in the Cards
entries: Haruspex often serve as performers in circus tricks, or work for high-ranking families, as a private fortune teller. Their ability to see future events is often useful for these families, and they are paid well.

entries.name: Seeking a Haruspex
entries: A haruspex will often have to hide themselves away while they are a beginner, otherwise they risk negatively influencing the futures of those around them.

Haruspicees rarely serve common folk, with the exception of predicting the future of a city or town for mass influence. The power that a haruspex holds is fueled by the belief others place in them. Haruspices travelling in a party often benefit from having good relations with their fellow travellers.

entries.name: The Eye of the Beholder
entries: A haruspex can see into the future, if only a short while. The act of them doing so is said to be quite exhausting. As such, many simply refuse to do so unless paid generously. This metaphysical 'eye' can take physical form on the haruspex, normally conforming to their personality, race and self-image.
For example, common forms include a third eye, a halo above the head, or additional non-physical limbs around the body, similar to an astral form.
Haruspices train rigorously to be able to use Future Sight, with some falling to the strain of future sight during their training.

entries.name: Creating a Haruspex
entries: When you create a haruspex, the first thing you want to consider is their past. Were they a performer in a circus? Perhaps a fortune-teller in a big city? Or were they a royal family's future sight?
Once you have chosen their past, you can begin to think about their future. What path will they follow as they strive for greatness? Or is it the opposite? Do they only wish to be alone?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a haruspex quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Wisdom. Second, choose the entertainer background.
If you wish to focus on using a haruspex's card effects, focus on Charisma. If you wish to focus on spellcasting, focus on Wisdom.
